text:
Question 80) Energy flow studies in ecosystems show that high productivity in mangroves is directly related to liquid primary production rates and rapid nutrient recycling. As an example of living beings found in this environment, we have: birds, crabs, insects, fish and algae.
Of the groups of living beings cited, those that contribute directly to the maintenance of this productivity in the referred ecosystem
A) Birds.
B) algae.
C) fish.
D) insects.
E) crabs.
